item.title: Hogwarts Legacy sales top 40 million
item.content:encoded:
Total sales for Hogwarts Legacy have surpassed 40 million units worldwide, publisher Warner Bros. Games and developer Avalanche Software announced.

The open-world action RPG based on the Harry Potter franchise first launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on February 10, 2023, followed by PlayStation 4 and Xbox One on May 5, 2023, Switch on November 14, 2023, and Switch 2 on June 5, 2025.

Hogwarts Legacy was last reported by Bloomberg to have surpassed 34 million sales in late March, meaning it sold six million additional units in eight months.

Here is a brief overview of the game, via Warner Bros. Games:

Published by Warner Bros. Games under the Portkey Games label and developed by Avalanche Software, Hogwarts Legacy is an immersive, action, open-world role-playing-game set in the 1800s wizarding world. Introducing an original story, the game puts fans at the center of their very own adventure. Beginning as a fifth-year student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, players embark on a journey through new and familiar locations, discover magical beasts, craft potions, master spell casting, upgrade talents and customize their character to become the witch or wizard they want to be.

item.title: Free MINOS holiday spin-off MINOS: Home A-Labyrinth now available for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

The trap-building gameplay of MINOS in a familiar holiday setting.

Publisher Devolver Digital and developer Artificer have announced MINOS: Home A-Labyrinth, a limited-time free holiday-themed spin-off of the upcoming roguelite game MINOS. It is available now for PC via Steam.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

MINOS: Home A-Labyrinth is a limited-time festive holiday special.

Use improvised defenses, handcrafted tricks, and a full arsenal of festive hazards to prevent clumsy intruders from invading your labyrinth in this (almost) cozy spin-off that reimagines the trap-building gameplay of MINOS in a familiar holiday setting.

Design and chain together traps, lure intruders into slapstick disasters, and protect your home from room to room. Expect quick sessions, chaotic encounters, and a playful celebration of defensive strategy.

This project was created as a lighthearted seasonal promo and released entirely for free. If you enjoy the experience, wishlist MINOS, our full-scale trap-building labyrinth roguelite coming soon.

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Mechanicus II launches in spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

New trailer showcases Scaevola and Ominekh.

Strategy game sequel Warhammer 40,000: Mechanicus II will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in spring 2026, publisher Kasedo Games and developer Bulwark Studios announced.

Here are the latest details:

The new release window will allow the team to further refine the experience in response to player requests following the Steam Next Fest demo, where it ranked among the event’s most played titles.

Building on this momentum, Bulwark Studios have listened closely to player feedback and have begun working on those widely requested features. The full game will now include an audio option to play with either “lingua-technis,” the binaric machine code language of the Adeptus Mechanicus that contributed heavily to the first game’s distinct atmosphere, or with the traditional human voiceover as heard in the demo. Movement systems are also being enhanced, with an optional setting to allow the Move action to auto-select when cycling between units, creating a smoother and more efficient tactical flow.

The team is equally committed to addressing performance concerns raised during the demo period. These optimizations, together with the continued refinement of new systems and campaign content, are central to delivering a sequel that meets the expectations set by both the community and the studio’s own ambitions.

Alongside the announcement, Kasedo Games have released the first in an ongoing video series which demonstrates customization systems and unique faction mechanics not present in the demo. Each instalment will highlight two deployable leaders, one each for the Adeptus Mechanicus and the Necrons, offering an in-depth look at their playstyles, abilities and strategic roles within the unfolding conflict.
